title: Easy pancakes
description: Learn how to make the perfect pancakes every time with our foolproof easy crêpe recipe – elaborate flip optional
author: Cassie Best

ingredients.raw: 1 tbsp sunflower or vegetable oil plus a little extra for frying
ingredients.ingredient: sunflower or vegetable oil plus a little extra for frying

instructions.text: Put 100g plain flour, 2 large eggs, 300ml milk, 1 tbsp sunflower or vegetable oil and a pinch of salt into a bowl or large jug, then whisk to a smooth batter. This should be similar in consistency to single cream.
ingredients: sunflower or vegetable oil plus a little extra for frying

instructions.text: Set aside for 30 mins to rest if you have time, or start cooking straight away.
Set a medium frying pan or crêpe pan over a medium heat and carefully wipe it with some oiled kitchen paper.
ingredients: sunflower or vegetable oil plus a little extra for frying

instructions.text: When hot, cook your pancakes for 1 min on each side until golden, using around half a ladleful of batter per pancake. Keep them warm in a low oven as you make the rest.
ingredients: sunflower or vegetable oil plus a little extra for frying

instructions.text: Serve with lemon wedges and caster sugar, or your favourite filling. Once cold, you can layer the pancakes between baking parchment, then wrap in cling film and freeze for up to two months.
